relation: Arrive at the international airport in Madrid (MAD) before 2pm. Students will be met by the resident directors and taken by private bus to the hotel in Madrid. First on-site orientation meeting at the hotel. Panoramic bus tour of Madrid in the evening.
Visit the Prado Museum or the Reina Sofia Museum, Retiro Park and the Royal Palace. Free evening.
Depart Madrid in the morning. Visit El Escorial before traveling to Toledo. Second on-site orientation meeting at the hotel in Toledo.
Guided tour of Toledo. Afternoon/evening free.
Depart Toledo in the morning for Granada (5 hour bus ride). Arrive in Granada and meet host families.
Placement exams at the University of Granada (CLM), afternoon tour of the city.
Regular class schedule begins (week 1). Classes meet Monday through Friday (4 hours/day). Afternoon cultural activities during the week.
Overnight Excursion: depart Granada in the morning for Córdoba. Visit Córdoba and continue on to Sevilla for the evening. Visit Sevilla on Sunday and return to Granada.
Regular class schedule continues (week 2). Afternoon cultural activities during the week.
Regular class schedule continues (week 3). Afternoon cultural activities during the week.
Day Trip: depart Granada in the morning for the Alpujarras. Hiking in the surrounding area and villages. Return to Granada in the afternoon.
Regular class schedule continues (week 4). Afternoon cultural activities during the week.
Day Trip: depart Granada in the morning for Nerja. Spend the day at the beach and return to Granada in the afternoon.
Final exams. Depart Granada in the late evening on an overnight bus to Madrid.
Depart for the U.S. before noon.
pageTitle: Itinerary | ISA High School Study Abroad For College Credit
